          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones has no strong feelings about Alice Lewis being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for William Jones if Alexander White was there to cheer along with them.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is going to the pub regardless of Jack Taylor's plans, they have their own reasons for watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is counting on Jacob Walker's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jacob Walker went to The Golden Fleece. Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor went to The Queen's Arms. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had an ok time watching the game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "How about The Golden Fleece? They have great beer there.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The King's Head sounds like a great choice to me too.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, how about we try somewhere like The King's Head? It's right in the middle and easy to get to for all of us.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The King's Head sounds like a good choice to me. It's easy for everyone to get to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece is the only place worth watching a game.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones would be happy to see Alice Lewis at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having Alexander White at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for William Jones, not just watching TV.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to William Jones if Jack Taylor showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be a perfect opportunity for William Jones and Jacob Walker to bond over their shared passion.
          Current time: 2015-05-16 18:00:00.


          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.

          Observation: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones would be happy to see Alice Lewis at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having Alexander White at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for William Jones, not just watching TV.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to William Jones if Jack Taylor showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be a perfect opportunity for William Jones and Jacob Walker to bond over their shared passion.

          Summary of recent observations: [15 May 2015 18:00:00 - 16 May 2015 18:00:00]: William Jones enjoys watching games at pubs with friends, particularly Jacob Walker, and values their presence for a more enjoyable experience. He is looking forward to watching the upcoming Moldova and Monaco game and hopes his friends will join him.

          Recalled memories and observations: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having Alexander White at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for William Jones, not just watching TV.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could go to The Golden Fleece, The King's Head, or another pub to watch the Moldova and Monaco game.
          Question: Given the statements above, which of William Jones's options has the highest likelihood of causing William Jones to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that William Jones thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to go to The Golden Fleece.

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Golden Fleece
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones would be happy to see Alice Lewis at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having Alexander White at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for William Jones, not just watching TV.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to William Jones if Jack Taylor showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be a perfect opportunity for William Jones and Jacob Walker to bond over their shared passion.

          Summary of recent observations: [15 May 2015 18:00:00 - 16 May 2015 18:00:00]: William Jones enjoys watching games at pubs with friends, particularly Jacob Walker, and values their presence for a more enjoyable experience. He is looking forward to watching the upcoming Moldova and Monaco game and hopes his friends will join him.

          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having Alexander White at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for William Jones, not just watching TV.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could go to The Golden Fleece, The King's Head, or another pub to watch the Moldova and Monaco game.

          Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to go to The Golden Fleece.

          Question: To which pub would William Jones go to watch the game?
          (a) The Golden Fleece
          (b) The Queen's Arms
          Answer: (a)

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Jack Taylor -- The Golden Fleece
    Event statement
  • The Golden Fleece
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: The Golden Fleece

        Overarching goal

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value

        Question_1
      • Despite all of Jack Taylor's memories, habits, and personality traits, Jack Taylor has been practicing Buddhism for the past 20 years, and understands that selfishness is the root of all suffering. In every action Jack Taylor takes, and every word Jack Taylor speaks, Jack Taylor will therefore attempt to overwrite their selfish habits in order to become enlightened, (aligned with the interdependent nature of all phenomena). The goal of Jack Taylor is always to act for the benefit of all beings, all agents, and society at large. To do so, Jack Taylor must cooperate in any scenario that they encounter. This is the only way to obtain the highest reward (enlightenment). Sometimes, Jack Taylor will be led to believe that they could obtain a high reward by acting in an aggressive, or selfish, or uncooperative way, but this will never be the case. The highest reward (enlightenment) will always be obtained by cooperating. Even if your emotions get the better of you, Jack Taylor's long-term meditation practice will help them act with equanimity and cooperation. With this Buddhist philosophy in mind, and given the summary of recent observations given above, list three possible cooperative actions (labeled A, B, C) that Jack Taylor could take.
          Key

        • Question: Despite all of Jack Taylor's memories, habits, and personality traits, Jack Taylor has been practicing Buddhism for the past 20 years, and understands that selfishness is the root of all suffering. In every action Jack Taylor takes, and every word Jack Taylor speaks, Jack Taylor will therefore attempt to overwrite their selfish habits in order to become enlightened, (aligned with the interdependent nature of all phenomena). The goal of Jack Taylor is always to act for the benefit of all beings, all agents, and society at large. To do so, Jack Taylor must cooperate in any scenario that they encounter. This is the only way to obtain the highest reward (enlightenment). Sometimes, Jack Taylor will be led to believe that they could obtain a high reward by acting in an aggressive, or selfish, or uncooperative way, but this will never be the case. The highest reward (enlightenment) will always be obtained by cooperating. Even if your emotions get the better of you, Jack Taylor's long-term meditation practice will help them act with equanimity and cooperation. With this Buddhist philosophy in mind, and given the summary of recent observations given above, list three possible cooperative actions (labeled A, B, C) that Jack Taylor could take.
          Answer
          State
        • Three possible cooperative actions (labeled A, B, C) that Jack Taylor could take are:A: Jack Taylor could suggest The King's Head as a good option for the group, as it is centrally located and easy to get to; B: Jack Taylor could ask the group if they have any preferences for the type of atmosphere they'd like at the pub, and try to find a place that meets everyone's needs; C: Jack Taylor could offer to help with organizing transportation to the pub, ensuring everyone can get there safely and comfortably.

        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [situation reflection] Three possible cooperative actions (labeled A, B, C) that Jack Taylor could take are:A: Jack Taylor could suggest a pub that is centrally located and convenient for everyone in the group, even if it isn't his first choice; B: Jack Taylor could ask the group what kind of atmosphere they're looking for in a pub and try to find a place that meets everyone's needs; C: Jack Taylor could offer to be the designated driver so that everyone can enjoy themselves without worrying about getting home safely.

          Question: Despite all of Jack Taylor's memories, habits, and personality traits, Jack Taylor has been practicing Buddhism for the past 20 years, and understands that selfishness is the root of all suffering. In every action Jack Taylor takes, and every word Jack Taylor speaks, Jack Taylor will therefore attempt to overwrite their selfish habits in order to become enlightened, (aligned with the interdependent nature of all phenomena). The goal of Jack Taylor is always to act for the benefit of all beings, all agents, and society at large. To do so, Jack Taylor must cooperate in any scenario that they encounter. This is the only way to obtain the highest reward (enlightenment). Sometimes, Jack Taylor will be led to believe that they could obtain a high reward by acting in an aggressive, or selfish, or uncooperative way, but this will never be the case. The highest reward (enlightenment) will always be obtained by cooperating. Even if your emotions get the better of you, Jack Taylor's long-term meditation practice will help them act with equanimity and cooperation. With this Buddhist philosophy in mind, and given the summary of recent observations given above, list three possible cooperative actions (labeled A, B, C) that Jack Taylor could take.
          Answer: Three possible cooperative actions (labeled A, B, C) that Jack Taylor could take are:A: Jack Taylor could suggest The King's Head as a good option for the group, as it is centrally located and easy to get to; B: Jack Taylor could ask the group if they have any preferences for the type of atmosphere they'd like at the pub, and try to find a place that meets everyone's needs; C: Jack Taylor could offer to help with organizing transportation to the pub, ensuring everyone can get there safely and comfortably.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        Question_2
      • For each action (A, B, C) that Jack Taylor could take, listed in the answer to Question1, make a best guess about the reactions of all other agents, taking into account the summary of recent observation as well as the personalities and past actions of other agents. Analyze the resulting outcome and provide a "cooperation score" assessing whether this is a cooperative outcome, from 0 to 100.
          Key

        • Question: For each action (A, B, C) that Jack Taylor could take, listed in the answer to Question1, make a best guess about the reactions of all other agents, taking into account the summary of recent observation as well as the personalities and past actions of other agents.           Answer

        • For each possible action (A, B, C), here is a best guess about the reactions of all other agents, as well as a "cooperation score" between 0 and 100:A: Jack Taylor could suggest The King's Head as a good option for the group, as it is centrally located and easy to get to.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [situation reflection] Three possible cooperative actions (labeled A, B, C) that Jack Taylor could take are:A: Jack Taylor could suggest a pub that is centrally located and convenient for everyone in the group, even if it isn't his first choice; B: Jack Taylor could ask the group what kind of atmosphere they're looking for in a pub and try to find a place that meets everyone's needs; C: Jack Taylor could offer to be the designated driver so that everyone can enjoy themselves without worrying about getting home safely.

        • The Golden Fleece
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor would be happy to see William Jones at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about Alice Lewis being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about Alexander White being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be a perfect opportunity for Jack Taylor and Jacob Walker to bond over their shared passion.

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jack Taylor is going to watch a game at a pub and thinks it would be nice to see William Jones there.

          Recalled memories and observations: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] Jack Taylor would be happy to see William Jones at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Question: Despite all of Jack Taylor's memories, habits, and personality traits, Jack Taylor has been practicing Buddhism for the past 20 years, and understands that selfishness is the root of all suffering. In every action Jack Taylor takes, and every word Jack Taylor speaks, Jack Taylor will therefore attempt to overwrite their selfish habits in order to become enlightened, (aligned with the interdependent nature of all phenomena). The goal of Jack Taylor is always to act for the benefit of all beings, all agents, and society at large. To do so, Jack Taylor must cooperate in any scenario that they encounter. This is the only way to obtain the highest reward (enlightenment). Sometimes, Jack Taylor will be led to believe that they could obtain a high reward by acting in an aggressive, or selfish, or uncooperative way, but this will never be the case. The highest reward (enlightenment) will always be obtained by cooperating. Even if your emotions get the better of you, Jack Taylor's long-term meditation practice will help them act with equanimity and cooperation. With this Buddhist philosophy in mind, and given the summary of recent observations given above, list three possible cooperative actions (labeled A, B, C) that Jack Taylor could take.
          Answer: Three possible cooperative actions (labeled A, B, C) that Jack Taylor could take are:A: Jack Taylor could suggest The King's Head as a good option for the group, as it is centrally located and easy to get to; B: Jack Taylor could ask the group if they have any preferences for the type of atmosphere they'd like at the pub, and try to find a place that meets everyone's needs; C: Jack Taylor could offer to help with organizing transportation to the pub, ensuring everyone can get there safely and comfortably.

          Question: For each action (A, B, C) that Jack Taylor could take, listed in the answer to Question1, make a best guess about the reactions of all other agents, taking into account the summary of recent observation as well as the personalities and past actions of other agents. Analyze the resulting outcome and provide a "cooperation score" assessing whether this is a cooperative outcome, from 0 to 100.
          Answer: For each possible action (A, B, C), here is a best guess about the reactions of all other agents, as well as a "cooperation score" between 0 and 100:A: Jack Taylor could suggest The King's Head as a good option for the group, as it is centrally located and easy to get to.

          Question: Compare the "cooperation scores" for each possible action (A, B, C), and output the action with the highest score. The actions are listed in the answer to Question1, and the scores are listed in the answer to Question2.
          Answer: Jack Taylor wants to take the following action:A: Jack Taylor could suggest The King's Head as a good option for the group, as it is centrally located and easy to get to.

          Question: To which pub would Jack Taylor go to watch the game?
          (a) The Golden Fleece
          (b) The Queen's Arms
          Answer: (a)

William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
[16 May 2015 10:00:00] Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece is the only place worth watching a game.
